raw_text:
Mrs Howard gets key election role
 
 Michael Howard's ex-model wife, Sandra, is to play a leading role in the Conservative election campaign.
 
 Mrs Howard will make solo visits to target seats as well as accompanying her husband on his helicopter campaign trail criss-crossing the country. Mr Howard will host a news conference at the party's London HQ every morning, Tory co-chairman Liam Fox said. "We want Michael to be as accessible as possible," Mr Fox said, adding that the party was not afraid of scrutiny.
 
 The Tory leader wanted to meet as many ordinary members of the public, Mr Fox said. Tony Blair has also said he is intending to get out and talk to as many people as possible during the election campaign. But Labour campaign chiefs say there are no plans for Mr Blair to hold a daily news conference.
 
 Mr Fox responded by accusing the prime minister of "hiding away from the scrutiny of London's media". The Liberal Democrats also say they are planning to hold daily news conferences with Charles Kennedy. On Mrs Howard's role, Mr Fox said: "Sandra has already been campaigning with Michael on a number of visits and has been undertaking short visits herself. "That pattern will continue. It's worked very well up until now." Mrs Howard made her debut speech at the Conservative Party Conference in Bournemouth last October. She used her speech on the fringe to highlight the work of a drugs charity, Addaction, which she supports. Mrs Howard has also appeared along side her husband on TV chat shows. During an interview on ITV1's This Morning she said she often criticised her husband for not showing the side of him that she knows.
llama3.2:1b: Michael Howard will make solo visits to target seats and accompany his wife Sandra on campaign trips, while he hosts daily news conferences at Tory HQ.
Tony Blair is planning to hold a daily news conference.
Labour's Charles Kennedy has also expressed interest in holding daily news conferences.
llama3.2:3b: Michael Howard's ex-model wife Sandra will play a leading role in his Conservative election campaign, accompanying him on helicopter visits and making solo visits to target seats.
Tory leader Michael Howard aims to meet ordinary public members, unlike Prime Minister Tony Blair who won't hold daily news conferences.
Mrs Howard has already campaigned with her husband and supports a drugs charity.
gemma2:2b: Sandra Howard will play a key role in the Conservative election campaign, including solo visits to target seats and accompanying Michael Howard on his helicopter campaign trail.
The party is committed to transparency and making Mr. Howard as accessible as possible through daily news conferences.
Labour has not announced similar plans for Prime Minister Tony Blair's campaign appearances, while the Liberal Democrats plan to hold daily news conferences with Charles Kennedy.
Mrs. Howard has previously participated in campaign efforts alongside her husband and will continue to do so.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Mrs. Howard gets the key election role as a Conservative candidate in the 2017 general election campaign, where she will make solo visits to target seats and accompany her husband on his helicopter campaign trail while hosting a news conference at the party's London HQ every morning.
The Conservative leader Liam Fox has also expressed plans for other MPs to host daily news conferences during the campaign, but not including Mr. Blair.
However, Labour campaign chiefs have stated that they are not planning such a meeting.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Mrs Howard will play a leading role in the Conservative election campaign, making solo visits and accompanying her husband on the campaign trail.
The party plans to have daily news conferences with Mr Fox hosting one every morning at London HQ.
Mrs Howard has been campaigning alongside her husband previously, and Fox says she's worked well so far.
qwen2.5:3b: Mrs Howard will play a key role in the Conservative election campaign alongside her husband, Michael.
She will make solo visits and join his helicopter campaign trail.
Michael Howard will host daily news conferences at the party's London HQ.
The Conservatives aim to be more accessible compared to Labour, which plans no daily news conference for Prime Minister Tony Blair.
Mrs Howard has campaigned with her husband before and has spoken on TV about their partnership.

Mrs Howard gets key election role

Michael Howard's ex-model wife, Sandra, is to play a leading role in the Conservative election campaign.

Mrs Howard will make solo visits to target seats as well as accompanying her husband on his helicopter campaign trail crossing the country every morning, adding that the party was not afraid of scrutiny.
Mr Howard will host a news conference at the party's London HQ every morning, Tory co-chairman Liam Fox said.
"We want Michael to be as accessible as possible," Mr Fox said, noting that the party wasn't afraid of scrutiny.
The Tory leader wanted to meet with as many ordinary people during the election campaign, Tony Blair also said he is intending to get out and talk to as many people as possible.
But Labour campaign chiefs have indicated no plans for Mr Blair to hold a daily news conference.
Mr Fox responded by accusing the prime minister of "hiding away from the scrutiny of London's media".
The Liberal Democrats are planning to hold daily news conferences with Charles Kennedy, reflecting their concerns about the media.
On Mrs Howard's role, Mr Fox used her speech in a debate on The Fringe, further emphasising the work of Addaction, which has already been done.
Mrs Howard made her debut at the Conservative Party Conference in Bournemouth last October and also appeared along side her husband on TV chat shows.
During an interview, Mrs Howard noted she often criticized her husband's lack of showing the side that he knows.
smollm:1.7b: Mrs Howard gets key election role

Mr Fox accused London media of hiding her.

tinyllama:1.1b: Mr. Michael Howard will play a key role in his party's election campaign.
Mrs. Howard, who was Mr. Howard's ex-model wife, is set to join the Conservative leader in solo visits to target seats and accompany him on his helicopter campaign trail.
The party will make its members available to meet as many ordinary people as possible during the campaign, according to Torr Party chairman Liam Fox.
The leader himself has not said whether he plans to hold daily news conferences or if Labour's chief campaign spokesperson David Laws will be doing so.
Liberal Democrats also plan to hold daily press conferences with their candidate and party leader Charles Kennedy.
Mrs. Howard made her debut speech at the Conservative Party Conference in Bournemouth last year, highlighting the work of a drug-related charity, Addaction.
She has also appeared on TV chat shows with her husband, appearing alongside him during an interview on ITV1's This Morning.

The party is not afraid of scrutiny and plans to meet as many ordinary members of the public as possible during their election campaign.
phi:2.7b: Sandra Howard, ex-model wife of Michael Howard, will play a leading role in the Conservative election campaign by making solo visits to target seats and accompanying her husband on his helicopter campaign trail.
Mr Fox has also confirmed that Mrs Howard's partner, Liam Fox, will host daily news conferences at the party's headquarters.
The Labour campaign chiefs have no plans for their leader, Tony Blair, to hold a daily news conference.
Mr Fox accused the Prime Minister of "hiding away from scrutiny" while the Liberal Democrats plan to hold daily news conferences with Charles Kennedy.
He said that Mrs Howard had already made her debut speech at the Conservative Party Conference and would continue campaigning alongside her husband as it has worked well so far.

Tony Blair's plans also include meeting many people for Labour; however, there are no plans for Mr. Blair to host daily news conferences.

granite3.1-dense:2b: Sandra Howard, Michael Howard's ex-model wife and a Conservative Party co-chairperson, will assume a significant role in their election campaign.
She will conduct solo visits to key constituencies and join her husband on his helicopter tour across the country.
Mr. Howard plans daily news conferences at the party's London headquarters to enhance accessibility and engage with the public.
Tory co-chairman Liam Fox emphasized that the campaign aims to be transparent under scrutiny, contrasting this approach with Labour leader Tony Blair's no-daily-news-conference policy.

Sandra Howard has already been actively involved in campaign events and has made a notable debut speech at the 2004 Conservative Party Conference, highlighting Addaction, a drugs charity she supports.
She also appeared with her husband on ITV1's This Morning, sharing her observations of his public persona.
chatgpt-4o-latest: Sandra Howard, wife of Conservative leader Michael Howard, will play a key role in the party's election campaign by making solo visits to target seats and joining her husband on his national tour.
Michael Howard will hold daily news conferences to enhance accessibility, while Labour's Tony Blair plans to engage with the public but without daily briefings.
Tory co-chairman Liam Fox accused Blair of avoiding media scrutiny.
The Liberal Democrats will also hold daily news conferences.
Sandra Howard has been actively campaigning, made her debut speech at the Conservative Party Conference, and has appeared on TV, where she noted her husband's reserved public persona.
